description: three panels hinged together; central panel has pair of figures at center foreground wearing gold capes, figure in blue at right with donkey, blue horse flying through sky at top center, figure playing a bass viol looking down into a pit of severed heads, arms, hands and a death's head with a horn, nude couple at left and musicians emerging from caves at left and right; left panel has blonde man playing an organ, beagle dog and blue shrouded figure behind a Pierrot in blue standing on his head on a drum; right panel has musicians and figures wearing masks emerging from a cave at left, skeleton holding a sheet of music in crevice at left and carved stone gargoyle and stone female figure holding rabbit at right
dimension: 115 x 309 x 17 1/2 in. (292.1 x 784.86 x 44.45 cm) (overall, with side panels turned inward)
marks: Signature and Date LRC, in tan: [JS / 02 / 03]
title: The Circus of the Night
